events.name: EV Power Battery Recycling System
events.wd_description: Establishing an effective recycling system for spent power batteries in China to manage the large-scale retirement of EV power batteries under the carbon cap-and-trade policy.
events.description: Establishing an effective recycling system for spent power batteries in China to manage the large-scale retirement of EV power batteries under the carbon cap-and-trade policy.

events.name: recycling mode selection
events.wd_description: Investigation of recycling modes involving various participants such as retailers, third-party recyclers, and echelon utilization enterprises.
events.description: Investigation of recycling modes involving various participants such as retailers, third-party recyclers, and echelon utilization enterprises.

events.name: ed-channel recycling modes
events.wd_description: Proposal of four recycling modes involving two or three parties: retailer, third-party recycler, and echelon utilization enterprise.
events.description: Proposal of four recycling modes involving two or three parties: retailer, third-party recycler, and echelon utilization enterprise.

events.name: erse chain process
events.wd_description: Collected spent power batteries are classified and processed by echelon utilization enterprises and manufacturers.
events.description: Collected spent power batteries are classified and processed by echelon utilization enterprises and manufacturers.

events.name: carbon abatement decision
events.wd_description: Decision-making regarding carbon reduction activities in the recycling process under the carbon cap-and-trade policy.
events.description: Decision-making regarding carbon reduction activities in the recycling process under the carbon cap-and-trade policy.

events.name: equilibrium results
events.wd_description: Analysis of equilibrium results using Stackelberg game models to determine optimal recycling modes and the impact on total recycling quantity and carbon emissions.
events.description: Analysis of equilibrium results using Stackelberg game models to determine optimal recycling modes and the impact on total recycling quantity and carbon emissions.

events.name: petition intensity
events.wd_description: Analysis of the impact of competition intensity among recycling channels on the recycling system.
events.description: Analysis of the impact of competition intensity among recycling channels on the recycling system.

events.name: ycling price sensitivity
events.wd_description: Examination of how recycling price sensitivity affects the total recycling quantity.
events.description: Examination of how recycling price sensitivity affects the total recycling quantity.

events.name: ufacturer’s profit
events.wd_description: Evaluation of the manufacturer's profit based on different recycling modes and carbon reduction activities.
events.description: Evaluation of the manufacturer's profit based on different recycling modes and carbon reduction activities.

events.name: Closed loop supply chain
events.description: Establishing an effective recycling system for EV power batteries within a closed-loop supply chain under the carbon cap-and-trade policy.

events.name: Mixed channel recycling modes
events.description: Four proposed mixed-channel recycling modes involving retailers, third-party recyclers, and echelon utilization enterprises.

events.name: Stackelberg game models
events.description: Equilibrium results are obtained by solving Stackelberg game models to determine optimal recycling modes and strategies.

events.name: Carbon trading price impact
events.description: Higher carbon trading prices encourage manufacturers to implement carbon reduction activities, reducing total carbon emissions.

events.name: Echelon utilization enterprise engagement
events.description: The involvement of echelon utilization enterprises positively affects recycling pressure relief and manufacturer's profit improvement.
